Applying Filters to a Report

As stated in earlier sections, filters allow you to narrow down your results. The column selection obviously determines the report structure by dictating what information will be presented. Filters determine which rows will come back in the results when BIQ executes your report. When you say something like, “I want to see all of my 2012 product shipments by month, but only for the northeast region”, you’ve just specified two filters: 2012, and northeast region. Note that month in this case is not a filter, but rather it’s a column. When you want to see something broken out by something else, that something else needs to be included as a column in the report definition.

The available filters are displayed on the right side of the screen in a separate panel. Depending on the data type (e.g. a calendar month, text string, etc.), you will see different screen controls that are most appropriate for searching through the different values.
